page.title: 14FORESTRY
page.content:
Forestry has been carried out on the Goodwood Estate for over 200 years. Many of the beech trees were planted in the time of the 3rd or 4th Dukes of Richmond. The total area of the forest is approximately 2.220 hectares.Most of the Estate woodland is productive, that means conifers or hardwoods for selling and some is unproductive, growing thorn, scrub, poor quality ash, oak and beech. The soil is thin rendzina over chalk and some low lying clay with gravel.
There is one head woodman and five woodmen. The felling and replanting now covers 4 hectares each year and 2,000 cubic metres of timber is produced. By Jason.
